title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for correct directions of the net forces at all the locations on the semicircular sections (i.e., all directed generally toward the center of the circle)

1 point is earned for correct directions of the net forces at all the locations on the bottom straightaways (i.e., directed toward the center of the segment)

1 point is earned for correct directions of the net forces at all locations on the top straightaway (i.e., both rightmost arrows directed toward the left, the left one for car X directed toward the right, and the left one for car Y equal to zero)
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

1 point is earned for correct directions of the net forces at all the locations on the semicircular sections (i.e., all directed generally toward the center of the circle)

1 point is earned for correct directions of the net forces at all the locations on the bottom straightaways (i.e., directed toward the center of the segment)

1 point is earned for correct directions of the net forces at all locations on the top straightaway (i.e., both rightmost arrows directed toward the left, the left one for car X directed toward the right, and the left one for car Y equal to zero)

The student response earns one of the following points:

1 point is earned for correct directions of the net forces at all the locations on the semicircular sections (i.e., all directed generally toward the center of the circle)

1 point is earned for correct directions of the net forces at all the locations on the bottom straightaways (i.e., directed toward the center of the segment)

1 point is earned for correct directions of the net forces at all locations on the top straightaway (i.e., both rightmost arrows directed toward the left, the left one for car X directed toward the right, and the left one for car Y equal to zero)

The student response earns two of the following points:

1 point is earned for correct directions of the net forces at all the locations on the semicircular sections (i.e., all directed generally toward the center of the circle)

1 point is earned for correct directions of the net forces at all the locations on the bottom straightaways (i.e., directed toward the center of the segment)

1 point is earned for correct directions of the net forces at all locations on the top straightaway (i.e., both rightmost arrows directed toward the left, the left one for car X directed toward the right, and the left one for car Y equal to zero)

The student response earns all of the following points:

1 point is earned for correct directions of the net forces at all the locations on the semicircular sections (i.e., all directed generally toward the center of the circle)

1 point is earned for correct directions of the net forces at all the locations on the bottom straightaways (i.e., directed toward the center of the segment)

1 point is earned for correct directions of the net forces at all locations on the top straightaway (i.e., both rightmost arrows directed toward the left, the left one for car X directed toward the right, and the left one for car Y equal to zero)

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for realizing that the difference in time is only on the straightaways

1 point is earned for correct reasoning leading to Car Y taking a shorter time on the straightaways

Example:

Car X takes longer to accelerate and does not spend any time traveling at top speed. Car Y accelerates over a shorter time and spends time going at top speed. So car Y must cover the straightaways in a shorter time. Curves take the same time, so car Y must overall take a shorter time.

The time to travel each curve is d/vc. Answers can be expressed in terms of d/vc or tc = d/vc or some other defined unit of time. The calculations below will use tc = d/vc.

1 point is earned for stating that the time to travel each curve is d/vc

1 point is earned for correct kinematics expressions that allow determination of the time it takes for one segment of acceleration on the straightaways

Example:D= v c t 1 + 1 2 a t 1 2 ,a=( 2 v c − v c )/ t 1 = v c / t 1 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGceaqabeaacaWGfb GaamiEaiaadggacaWGTbGaamiCaiaadYgacaWGLbGaaiOoaiaadsea cqGH9aqpcaWG2bWaaSbaaSqaaiaadogaaeqaaOGaamiDamaaBaaale aacaaIXaaabeaakiabgUcaRmaalaaabaGaaGymaaqaaiaaikdaaaGa amyyaiaadshadaqhaaWcbaGaaGymaaqaaiaaikdaaaGccaGGSaGaam yyaiabg2da9maabmaabaGaaGOmaiaadAhadaWgaaWcbaGaam4yaaqa baGccqGHsislcaWG2bWaaSbaaSqaaiaadogaaeqaaaGccaGLOaGaay zkaaGaai4laiaadshadaWgaaWcbaGaaGymaaqabaGccqGH9aqpcaWG 2bWaaSbaaSqaaiaadogaaeqaaOGaai4laiaadshadaWgaaWcbaGaaG ymaaqabaaakeaaaaaa@5B4B@

1 point is earned for work that shows an understanding of how to determine the time that car X and car Y each spend accelerating

1 point is earned for work that shows an understanding of how to determine the time that car Y spends at constant speed

1 point is earned for correctly determining the total straightaway times for each car

Calculating the time for car X to travel one straightaway:

d 2 = v c t 1 + 1 2 a t 1 2 ,a=( 2 v c − v c )/ t 1 = v c / t 1 t 1 = d 3 v c = t c 3 ,total time is  2 t c 3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@703A@

Calculating the time for car Y to travel one straightaway:

Doing the calculation shown above using the distance of acceleration gives the result that one section of acceleration takes a time tc/6.

The time for car Y to travel one constant speed section on the straightaway is (d/2)/2vc = (tc/4)

Adding three segments to get the total time for one straightaway gives 7tc/12.

The calculations show that car Y takes less time on a straightaway, and both cars take the same time on the curves, so car Y overall takes less time.

Example:D= v c t 1 + 1 2 a t 1 2 ,a=( 2 v c − v c )/ t 1 = v c / t 1 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGceaqabeaacaWGfb GaamiEaiaadggacaWGTbGaamiCaiaadYgacaWGLbGaaiOoaiaadsea cqGH9aqpcaWG2bWaaSbaaSqaaiaadogaaeqaaOGaamiDamaaBaaale aacaaIXaaabeaakiabgUcaRmaalaaabaGaaGymaaqaaiaaikdaaaGa amyyaiaadshadaqhaaWcbaGaaGymaaqaaiaaikdaaaGccaGGSaGaam yyaiabg2da9maabmaabaGaaGOmaiaadAhadaWgaaWcbaGaam4yaaqa baGccqGHsislcaWG2bWaaSbaaSqaaiaadogaaeqaaaGccaGLOaGaay zkaaGaai4laiaadshadaWgaaWcbaGaaGymaaqabaGccqGH9aqpcaWG 2bWaaSbaaSqaaiaadogaaeqaaOGaai4laiaadshadaWgaaWcbaGaaG ymaaqabaaakeaaaaaa@5B4B@

1 point is earned for work that shows an understanding of how to determine the time that car X and car Y each spend accelerating

1 point is earned for work that shows an understanding of how to determine the time that car Y spends at constant speed

1 point is earned for correctly determining the total straightaway times for each car

Calculating the time for car X to travel one straightaway:

d 2 = v c t 1 + 1 2 a t 1 2 ,a=( 2 v c − v c )/ t 1 = v c / t 1 t 1 = d 3 v c = t c 3 ,total time is  2 t c 3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@703A@

Calculating the time for car Y to travel one straightaway:

Doing the calculation shown above using the distance of acceleration gives the result that one section of acceleration takes a time tc/6.

The time for car Y to travel one constant speed section on the straightaway is (d/2)/2vc = (tc/4)

Adding three segments to get the total time for one straightaway gives 7tc/12.

The calculations show that car Y takes less time on a straightaway, and both cars take the same time on the curves, so car Y overall takes less time.

The student response earns all of the following points:

1 point is earned for realizing that the difference in time is only on the straightaways

1 point is earned for correct reasoning leading to Car Y taking a shorter time on the straightaways

Example:

Car X takes longer to accelerate and does not spend any time traveling at top speed. Car Y accelerates over a shorter time and spends time going at top speed. So car Y must cover the straightaways in a shorter time. Curves take the same time, so car Y must overall take a shorter time.

The time to travel each curve is d/vc. Answers can be expressed in terms of d/vc or tc = d/vc or some other defined unit of time. The calculations below will use tc = d/vc.

1 point is earned for stating that the time to travel each curve is d/vc

1 point is earned for correct kinematics expressions that allow determination of the time it takes for one segment of acceleration on the straightaways

Example:D= v c t 1 + 1 2 a t 1 2 ,a=( 2 v c − v c )/ t 1 = v c / t 1 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGceaqabeaacaWGfb GaamiEaiaadggacaWGTbGaamiCaiaadYgacaWGLbGaaiOoaiaadsea cqGH9aqpcaWG2bWaaSbaaSqaaiaadogaaeqaaOGaamiDamaaBaaale aacaaIXaaabeaakiabgUcaRmaalaaabaGaaGymaaqaaiaaikdaaaGa amyyaiaadshadaqhaaWcbaGaaGymaaqaaiaaikdaaaGccaGGSaGaam yyaiabg2da9maabmaabaGaaGOmaiaadAhadaWgaaWcbaGaam4yaaqa baGccqGHsislcaWG2bWaaSbaaSqaaiaadogaaeqaaaGccaGLOaGaay zkaaGaai4laiaadshadaWgaaWcbaGaaGymaaqabaGccqGH9aqpcaWG 2bWaaSbaaSqaaiaadogaaeqaaOGaai4laiaadshadaWgaaWcbaGaaG ymaaqabaaakeaaaaaa@5B4B@

1 point is earned for work that shows an understanding of how to determine the time that car Y spends at constant speed

Calculating the time for car X to travel one straightaway:

d 2 = v c t 1 + 1 2 a t 1 2 ,a=( 2 v c − v c )/ t 1 = v c / t 1 t 1 = d 3 v c = t c 3 ,total time is  2 t c 3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@703A@

Calculating the time for car Y to travel one straightaway:

Doing the calculation shown above using the distance of acceleration gives the result that one section of acceleration takes a time tc/6.

The time for car Y to travel one constant speed section on the straightaway is (d/2)/2vc = (tc/4)

Adding three segments to get the total time for one straightaway gives 7tc/12.

The calculations show that car Y takes less time on a straightaway, and both cars take the same time on the curves, so car Y overall takes less time.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for linking math to one aspect of qualitative reasoning that explains the difference in times

1 point is earned for linking math to all other qualitative reasoning that explains the difference in times

Examples:

The only difference in the calculations for the time of one segment of linear acceleration is the difference in distances. That shows that car X takes longer to accelerate. The equation(d/2)/2vc = (tc/4) corresponds to car Y traveling for a time at top speed.

Substituting a = vc/t1 into the displacement equation in part (b) ii gives D = (3/2)vct1. This shows that a car takes less time to reach its maximum speed when it accelerates over a shorter distance. This means Car Y reaches its maximum speed more quickly and therefore spends more time at its maximum speed than Car X does, as argued in part (b) i.
